lines.content: *Buzz* is your interactive task management chatbot designed to help you organize your daily to-dos, deadlines, and events—all while keeping the vibe fun and casual. Whether you're adding a new task or marking one as done, Buzz is here to guide you every step of the way.

When you launch Buzz, you'll be greeted with a friendly welcome message. From there, simply type in your commands following the formats outlined below. Buzz will respond with confirmation messages, helpful prompts, or error messages if something isn't quite right.
**Action:** Add a simple task without any time constraints.
todo Read the new Buzz documentation
- Buzz adds the task and confirms its addition, showing the updated task count.
Buzz: Added: [T][ ] Read the new Buzz documentation
Now you have X tasks in the list.
**Action:** Add a task that needs to be completed by a certain date/time.
- Buzz interprets the command as a deadline task.
- The task is stored with the specified due date, and Buzz confirms the addition.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
**Action:** Add a task that occurs within a specified time frame.
- Buzz adds an event task with a start time and an end time.
- A confirmation message shows the event details along with the updated task count.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
**Action:** View all the tasks currently in your list.
- Buzz prints a list of all tasks with their corresponding numbers.
- If no tasks exist, Buzz informs you accordingly.
Buzz: Here are the tasks in your list:
**Action:** Mark a specific task as completed.
- Buzz marks task number 2 as done, saves the changes, and confirms the update.
Buzz: I've marked this task as done, 1 less task to playing Brawl Stars!
### Marking a Task as Not Done
**Action:** Revert a task's status to not done.
- Buzz changes the status of task number 2 back to not done and provides confirmation.
Buzz: OK, I've unmarked this task, ugh I guess u better do it now.
**Action:** Remove a specific task from your list.
- Buzz deletes the specified task, updates the storage, and confirms the deletion along with the new task count.
Buzz: Noted. I've removed this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
**Action:** Search for tasks that contain a particular keyword.
- Buzz searches through the list of tasks and displays any tasks that include the keyword "meeting."
- If no matching tasks are found, you'll be informed accordingly.
Buzz: Here are the matching tasks in your list:
**Action:** Remove all tasks from your list permanently.
- Buzz warns you that this action will permanently delete all tasks.
- You must type "BUZZ" to confirm the reset. If confirmed, all tasks are cleared, and the storage is reset.
⚠️ WARNING: This will delete ALL your tasks permanently!
Type 'BUZZ' to proceed, or anything else to cancel:
- Buzz says goodbye and the application exits.
Buzz: Alright back to Brawl Stars :] byebye!
- **Command Format:** Commands are case-insensitive and must be entered in the correct format (e.g., using "by" for deadlines and "from ... to ..." for events).
- **Persistent Storage:** All tasks are automatically saved to a file so that your data remains even after you close the application.
- **User Feedback:** Buzz provides friendly and informative messages after each action, so you'll always know the current state of your task list.
Feel free to explore and manage your tasks using these simple commands. Enjoy your journey with Buzz—your personal task management companion!
For additional support, please refer to this guide. If you need further assistance, consider opening an issue or contacting [@kaixiangg](https://github.com/kaixiangg) directly.
Navigate to the Repository: Go to the GitHub repository where you encountered the issue.
Access the Issues Tab: Click on the "Issues" tab located at the top of the repository page.
Create a New Issue: Click the "New issue" button.
Fill Out the Issue Template: Provide a descriptive title and detailed information about the problem. Include steps to reproduce the issue, expected behavior, and any relevant screenshots or logs.
Submit the Issue: Once you've completed the form, click "Submit new issue" to post it.
